name: Health Points
description: This represents the amount of damage an entity can take before going
unconscious (or dying, in the case of some monsters or NPCs).

name: Magic Points
description: This represents the amount of magical energy an entity is able to utilize to
cast spells or use special abilities.

name: Strength
description: This determines how physically strong the entity is. This is added to the
attack roll for most physical non-ranged weapons and is also used to determine
whether the entity can equip some of the heavier weapons and armors.

name: Dexterity
description: This represents a measure of an entity's hand-eye coordination. This is added
to the attack roll for most physical ranged weapons (mainly bows and
crossbows).  This is also added to the attack roll for most martial arts
abilities.

name: Intelligence
description: Represents how easily an entity can understand spells and other forms of
magic. This is added to the attack roll for most magic attacks. This is also
a required stat in order to use some high level arcane items and spells.

name: Endurance
description: A measure of how resilient an entity's body is against physical damage.
This is added to the defense roll for all physical weapons (both ranged
and melee).

name: Spirit
description: A measure of how resilient an entity's mind is against magical damage
(including spectral damage). This is added to the defense roll for all
non-physical attacks.

name: Speed
description: How fast the user can move. This is both used to calculate initiative and
is also added to the number of squares an entity can move during a single
round of combat.
